message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with text spotting in images, which is a computer vision task, hence cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of neural approaches to learn semantic relatedness, which falls under the purview of natural language processing, making cs.CL a likely sub-category as well. The use of dimension reduction techniques like LDA and embedding-based neural approaches also suggests the possibility of the paper being categorized under cs.IR. The paper also discusses the use of machine learning techniques to improve the performance of vision systems, which falls under the purview of machine learning, making cs.LG a likely sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of semantic information to improve text spotting systems, which is a sub-field of artificial intelligence, making cs.AI a likely sub-category as well.
